title: Memoirs of the life and writings of Thomas Chalmers...
author: Hanna, William
snippet: " He dined generally at half-past four o'clock ; and it was Dr. Chalmers's practice to sally forth, as he playfully expressed it, after dinner, from his house in Windsor Place to St. John's parish, spending at least two hours several nights in the week among his parishioners. In these visits it was repeatedly my high privilege to accompany him.
